summary: This document is an email chain from August 2019 between the Office of the Inspector General (OIG) and the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York (USANYS) regarding Jeffrey Epstein's prison commissary records. The emails discuss obtaining records of individuals who sent money to Epstein and a request for the commissary record of another inmate, Efrain Reyes.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: The subject of the email chain; his prison commissary account (TruView) is being examined, showing he received money from three different people.

persons.name: Efrain Reyes
persons.context: A separate inmate (BOP number 85993-054) whose commissary record is also requested by the US Attorney's Office for the period since July 6, 2019.

events.title: OIG Provides Epstein's Commissary Records
events.description: The Office of the Inspector General emails Epstein's TruView account details and official BOP photo to the FBI and U.S. Attorney's Office, noting three transactions where he received money from three different people.

events.title: US Attorney's Office Requests Additional Commissary Records
events.description: The U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York requests commissary records for anyone who received money from specific individuals (names redacted) since July 6, 2019, and also requests the record for inmate Efrain Reyes.

keyFacts: Jeffrey Epstein's prison commissary account (TruView) showed only three transactions, where he received money from three different people.
The U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York was actively investigating financial transactions related to Epstein in prison in August 2019.
The investigation also extended to other inmates, as evidenced by the request for Efrain Reyes's commissary records.
The email chain indicates coordination between the Office of the Inspector General, the FBI, and the U.S. Attorney's Office regarding Epstein's prison activities.
Key individuals sending money to Epstein are redacted in the document, indicating an ongoing investigative interest in their identities.
